result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Randall Walters

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Randall Walters in court.  Attorney Connor Romenesko in court for Randall Walters.  Attorney William Ackell for Alexandria S. Carlson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case calendared for a Scheduling Conference.  DEFENDANT FAILED TO APPEAR. 
Defense has no explanation for defendants non appearance and  request a calendar call date.  
Court ordered bench warrant issued, Remand to the Judge and STAYED issuance until the next court date.

Case recalled at 9:32am. Same appearance. 
DEFENDANT APPEARS. Court Canceled stayed bench warrant and calendar call date  
Discussion held to determine the posture of the case. Defense counsel request a resolution hearing date.  
Court ordered this case adjourned back to Branch 19.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 18, 2023 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Randall Walters in court.  Attorney Connor Romenesko in court for Randall Walters. Attorney Ericka Strebel appeared in person for Attorney Alexandria S. Carlson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. 
Defense in receipt of some discovery and offer from the State. Defense needs more time to review with client.
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Crivello.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Kori Ashley, Br. 19.

Defendant Randall Walters in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Randall Walters appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded. Court took judicial notice of the defendant's 3 prior OWI convictions. Sworn for the State: MPD Officer L. Bracero. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 19.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Request for Substitution of Judge.  Received and Filed.  nk
Received and Filed: Attorney Connor Romenesko
We haven't received a bail payment in this case.  sb

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  
Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  
No driving without a valid license.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Randall Walters in court with attorney William Hotchkiss.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Crivello, Branch 36.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Randall Walters
Current: 4321 North 104th Street Apt 4, Milwaukee, WI 53225   (Effective: 08-02-2022)
Prior: 4321 North 104th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53225
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 500.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Randall Walters not in court.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
